narrative.title: 7Th Armoured Division - 1942Q3
narrative.situation: British Armoured Division deployed in North Africa during 1942Q3.
narrative.objectives: Mobile armoured division operating in defensive posture at El Alamein line (July-September 1942). Specialized in armoured counterattacks, reconnaissance in force, and defensive anchoring. 'Desert Rats' veteran desert warfare expertise applied to defensive operations.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain and rocky desert (El Alamein defensive line, Western Desert)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Veteran desert warfare experience (1940-1942 continuous operations)
Mobile counterattack operations from defensive positions
Tank gunnery excellence with Grant 75mm guns
Reconnaissance in depth with armoured cars
Defensive mine warfare and obstacle integration

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain and rocky desert (El Alamein defensive line, Western Desert)
